intro: Cassytha glabella f. bicallosa, commonly known as the hairy cassytha, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Lauraceae. It is a climbing vine characterized by its slender, twining stems and small, opposite leaves. The leaves are typically elliptical or ovate, with a smooth or slightly hairy surface, depending on the variety. It produces small, greenish-white flowers in clusters, which are followed by small, berry-like fruits. This plant is often found in moist, shaded environments in tropical and subtropical regions.
